tool.name: ExecuteNetworkSQLValidations

param.name: job__started_date
param.displayname: Edits Start Date (i.e. WMX Job Creation Date)

param.name: job__owned_by
param.displayname: Editor Username (i.e. WMX Owned by User)

tool.summary: Runs two SQL queries against the user's version of the Milepoint table. The first SQL query ensures that a single DOT_ID corresponds to 1 unique combination of SIGNING, ROUTE_NUMBER, ROUTE_SUFFIX, ROADWAY_TYPE, ROUTE_QUALIFIER, ROADWAY_FEATURE, and PARWAY_FLAG, regardless of the county order. The second SQL query ensures that for a given DOT_ID and COUNTY_ORDER combination, there is not a repeat of the DIRECTION code. The results of the query are used to select the offending ROUTE_IDs, and the Milepoint geometry is committed to the Reviewer Table.
tool.usage:
• The Job Start Date parameter should refer to the date from which the edits needing validation begain. Typically passed into the tool via a Workflow Manager token.

  • The Job Owned By parameter should refer to the username committed to the EDITED_DATE field on the Milepoint table.

  • The Job ID parameter refers to the Workflow Manager Job ID, which is used to recreate the Production Workspace version name.

  • Production Workspace must be an enterprise geodatabase, referred to by an SDE file.

  • The Reviewer Workspace parameter usually referse to an enterprise geodatabase that has been configured as a Data Reviewer Workspace. Also works with file geodatabases.

  • When the Log Path parameter is provided as a filepath pointing to a text file (.txt), the tool will log execution messages to the file.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Runs two SQL queries against the user's version of the Milepoint table. The first SQL query ensures that a single DOT_ID corresponds to 1 unique combination of SIGNING, ROUTE_NUMBER, ROUTE_SUFFIX, ROADWAY_TYPE, ROUTE_QUALIFIER, ROADWAY_FEATURE, and PARWAY_FLAG, regardless of the county order. The second SQL query ensures that for a given DOT_ID and COUNTY_ORDER combination, there is not a repeat of the DIRECTION code. The results of the query are used to select the offending ROUTE_IDs, and the Milepoint geometry is committed to the Reviewer Table.
